The selfie mode brightens the screen which can be used in low light.Things I didn't like:* High price for low specs. Samsung M51 at the same price point gives better specs. M51 vs V19 - 64MP Quad vs 48MP Quad, SD 730G vs SD AIE, 7000mAh battery vs 4500mAh battery, 6.7" display vs 6.44" display.If you can wait longer buy the upcoming V20 (it has 3+1 cameras though unlike 4+2 here).This phone is *only* good if you want to own a Vivo device. Compared to other Vivo models available here, V19 currently is the best deal (provided you have a card that's giving instant discount and no-cost EMI). The positive things lie mostly in Vivo's software. Hardware wise it's just average.

Name: Saheel Godhane
Title: Bought it for my dad, great midrange phone!
Comment: I wanted a midrange phone for my dad, be had iPhone 6s before. But did not want another 50k+ OnePlus, iphone, etc. because he doesn't have the need for those advanced features/specs. Nor the 10-15k Redmi phones that start hanging soon and have other problems.Vivo V19 fit that midrange budget. I considered V19 because V17 had great reviews (online as well as from friends) and V19 was just the natural successor.Performance 5/5. It's a very responsive device (meaning has good performance for day to day tasks and app switches). Dad plays multiple candy crush games at the same time and it is able to handle them just fine. Did not lag even once after weeks of usage.Screen is 4.3/5. No issues here. Very good screen. Not as awesome as flagship screens but that's to be expected. But most users, including my Dad, won't notice the difference at all!Camera is 3.8/5. I'm used to flagship device cameras so the camera on V19 felt underwhelming. It has quad cameras and all that but at the end of the day the photo quality is not the best. Since my dad uses the camera only occasionally, it is fine for him. Selfie camera is decent but main camera could've been better.Battery 5/5. Lasts more than a day for moderate usage. And very fast charging at 30W so that's great! That's Dad's key requirements so I'm quite happy with it.OS 4/5 There are some unnecessary softwares but you can just ignore those. The "utility" screen on the left of the main home screen is quite good! You can edit it to show only relevant stuff; by default it shows all kinds of things. The phone counts steps and calories, which is good to have but I am not sure if it does a very accurate job. The file manager and settings and other built in softwares are up to the mark. Phone calling is lacking however. It doesn't immediately show call history when I click on the Phone app, which is a bummer. Oh well...Overall - 4.5/5 I'm happy with the purchase. No obvious red flags. Ups and downs are to be expected at this price range. Even iPhones and other flagships have their own issues. Overall a great device for everyone (unless you want the best of the best and are willing to shell out the monies).I'll update this if some major issue comes up down the road. :)
